alert.note: Alert for Christian; Hopkins; Muhlenberg; Todd; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Muhlenberg, Christian, eastern Trigg, Todd and southeastern Hopkins Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 945 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Earlington to 6 miles north of Big Rock. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Earlington around 950 PM CDT. Madisonville, Nortonville and Mortons Gap around 955 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fort Campbell, Oak Grove, Graham, Central City, Pembroke, Powderly and Greenville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 65 and 92. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 95 and 115. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 65. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central and western Kentucky.
